result.execSummary:
The defendant Casey David Day was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Casey David Day
parties.address: 5724 West Beloit Road, West Allis, WI 53219

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.  Costs/surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Concurrent with: Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 12 months of Initial Confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational traning.

No drugs or alcohol, unless medically assisted treatment.
Do not frequent places where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
No contact with Joseph E. Sass funeral home at 1019 W. Oklahoma and any Menards without prior Court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Casey David Day

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript of PLEA/SENTENCING HEARING (23 pages) commencing 01/28/2015 received and filed.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Michael B Plaisted.  Defendant Casey David Day in custody.  Brad Alan Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.
COUNT 2 - CONCURRENT:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 32 MONTHS, with credit for 84 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 18 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 14 MONTHS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program after serving 12 months of initial confinement.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.  Unless medically assisted treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* No contact with Joseph E. Sass funeral home at 1019 W Oklahoma and any Menards without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.


  Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.

Attorney Michael B. Plaisted in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Deputy court clerk: LMS. OFF THE RECORD.    Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

The defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement.  Based upon the defendant's non-compliance, the court revoked the Milwaukee County Drug Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement; proceedings reinstated.  Court orders entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Michael B. Plaisted.  Defendant Casey David Day in custody.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Motion of the defense counsel, Caitlin Firer, to withdraw granted by the Court.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Paige A. Styler in court.  Brad A. Vorpahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued.  NO BAIL IS FORFEITED.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Caitlin Hazard Firer.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Caitlin H Firer.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

CASE RECALLED.

DTC - PHASE I
Review Hearing proceeds.  Court held colloquy with the defendant.  Court finds that the defendant is not quite in compliance with the Drug Treatment Court Contract.  No sanctions are imposed.  No points are awarded.  Sobriety date to be reset.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for July 11, 2014 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Cynthia M Wynn.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.  

DTC - PHASE I
Review Hearing proceeds. Court held colloquy with the defendant.  CASE PASSED.  Defendant to report to JusticePoint and then return to court.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Caitlin H Firer.  David T Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS. 

The parties have agreed to a Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court deferred prosecution agreement and participation contract.
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, entered a plea of GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The court approved the Milwaukee County Drug Treatment Court Deferred Prosecution Agreement and Participant Contract and ordered the proceedings suspended for an initial period of 12 months.  Court ordered case adjourned for review hearing in Branch 6.  FILE RETAINED IN COURT.  Review hearing scheduled for June 27, 2014 at 09:30 am.
Case transferred to br 6 for drug treatment court admissions on 6/25/2014 at 1:30pm.  lms

Defendant Casey David Day in court.  Defense counsel, Lisa Schlieben, appeared by phone.  Lucy J Kronforst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are awaiting approval from Drug Treatment Court and requests a little more time.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 34.  Status conference scheduled for 07-25-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Lisa M Schlieben.  Tyrone M St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant awaitng DTC admission.  Status conference scheduled for June 11, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant will be referred for drug treatment court.  Status conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for 04-09-2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs, appearing for Attorney Lisa Marie Schlieben.  Tyrone Martin St Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  City of Oak Creek Police Dept. Officer Julie Grauberger.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Court orders case adjourned to Branch 34 for scheduling conference.
Clerk:  jms

DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 3:00 P.M. ON MARCH 5, 2014. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Casey David Day in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  James W. Frisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Yamahiro, Branch 34.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.     Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
